data.question: What is the empirical formula of bio-MOF-1?
What method was used for procainamide loading into bio-MOF-1?
What is the BET surface area of bio-MOF-1?
What triggers the release of procainamide from bio-MOF-1?
Is bio-MOF-1 stable in biological buffers?
What is the role of adenine in the construction of bio-MOF-1?
data.answer: It serves as a biomolecular ligand.

data.question: Can bio-MOF-1's crystallinity be maintained after solvent exchange?
What is the weight loss percentage of bio-MOF-1 from room temperature to 125 °C according to TGA data?
How long does complete procainamide release from bio-MOF-1 take?
Does the procainamide-loaded bio-MOF-1 maintain its crystalline integrity throughout the release process?
What is the estimated amount of procainamide loaded into bio-MOF-1?
Is bio-MOF-1 anionic in nature?
What is the crystal system of bio-MOF-1?
What is the role of biphenyldicarboxylic acid in the synthesis of bio-MOF-1?
data.answer: It acts as an auxiliary linking molecule to promote the formation of larger accessible pores.

data.question: Does the addition of exogenous cations from biological buffers to bio-MOF-1 lead to the release of adsorbed drug molecules?
What is the function of dimethylammonium cations in bio-MOF-1?
data.answer: They are exchanged with cationic drug molecules during the loading process.

data.question: Is the framework structure of bio-MOF-1 anionic?
What is the main advantage of using bio-MOF-1 for drug delivery?
data.answer: Its ability to control the release of cationic drug molecules.

data.question: Can bio-MOF-1's porosity be permanently maintained?
What is the significance of the zinc−adeninate columnar secondary building units in bio-MOF-1?
data.answer: They are composed of apex-sharing zinc−adeninate octahedral cages that contribute to the framework's structure.
